Summary: I was driving home and the object crossed my line of sight heading west to east
trends: There have been 30 other sightings in Santa Rosa
There were no other sightings in Santa Rosa on or around August 31st 2005
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: sighting detailsi was leaving work at about 6:20 am (i work the night shift). i was approaching the intersection of stony point rd. and sebastopol rd. in the city of santa rosa ca. heading north on stony point rd. as i approached the intersection i noticed the object in the sky. at first i thought it might be a kite but it moved at a steady speed and course and appeared very rigid. i could not see any string or anything else attached to the object. it was totally silent. it was light but the sun was not up all the way. the object was opaque\clear. it was wedge shaped. a long tapered wedge. the outline of the entire object appeared as a very thin line. if it were a foot long the front of the wedge was about 2.5 inches tall and tapered to a point at the other end and maybe 5 inches wide. i���m just guessing that it was actually between 10 and 20 feet long. the front of the wedge was a very bright white light. it appeared as though the front of the wedge was cylinder shaped a glowing cylinder. i am just guessing but it appeared to be fairly close, within a hundred yards or so. i have no way of knowing its' actual size so it's hard to say how close it was. i would say it was 30 or 40 degrees above the horizon and that aspect changed as it got closer to crossing above the road in front of me (maybe a more southeasterly course). by the time it crossed the road i was at a stop light watching. i believe there were two other cars that i noticed one facing south opposite of me and i think one in front of me that made it through the light. the speed of the object seemed fairly slow, maybe 5 to 10 mph (just a guess because i don't know how far away it was). i watched it head to the southeast towards what would be the community of redland. this was totally 180 degrees from when i first saw it. the light turned green and i watched it over my shoulder as i continued home. that���s it. not very exciting but i've never seen anything like it before or since. thanks, tim livingston
